title: Gareth Jones (rugby union)
text:
Gareth Jones (4 December 1979 – 16 June 2008) was a <a href="Wales">Welsh</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who played as a <a href="Scrum-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">scrum-half</a> for <a href="Neath%20RFC">Neath</a> rugby club until his death in 2008.
Club career.
Jones started his career with Glyncoch and then progressed to play for <a href="Beddau%20RFC">Beddau</a> and <a href="Pontypridd%20RFC">Pontypridd</a>, before making his debut for Neath in 2006 against <a href="Newport%20RFC">Newport</a>. He was also a part-time decorator.
Death.
After sustaining an injury to his neck during a game against <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff</a> in the Premier Division in a ruck on 20 April 2008, Jones was taken to the <a href="University%20Hospital%20of%20Wales">University Hospital of Wales</a> for treatment. During his time there, he received operations and treatment to help with his injury, but died on the afternoon of 16 June.
